description.narrative: Enhanced capacity of justice and security sector institutions to respond to COVID-19 pandemic

activity-description.narrative: To support post COVID recovery in Sierra Leone

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative:
Output 3: UNDP ROL COVID-19 Intervention
 5 SLCS facilities equipped with water and sanitation facilities to ensure proper hygiene is maintained during COVID-19 pandemic.  5 Isolation units equipped for new inmates.  100 inmates released through 5 functioning pilot Virtual Courts with 12 panels of 12 Jurors.  2 Monitoring sessions conducted by the SID of the SLCS to monitor and exercise oversight on the functioning of the SLCS facilities across 6 districts.  At least 400 community residents and security personnel are capacitated on the Luanda Guidelines on democratic policing and border security.  At least 90 security personnel capacitated to apply human rights standards in manning checkpoints, quarantine homes and monitoring lockdown   5 out of 8 districts 500,000 people reached in remote communities in 5 districts with messages on COVID-19 to ensure they protect themselves and remain safe and dispelling misinformation.

  3 Correctional facilities in Port Loko, Moyamba and Bo equipped to ensure continuous functioning during COVID-19 through the provision water, hygiene and sanitation facilities to ensure judges, inmates and staffs stay safe.
 Isolation facilities in 5 correctional centres equipped with essential hygiene items to service newly admitted inmates.
 2 Monitoring mission to correctional centres in 8 districts conducted by SID to assess their compliance with the Mandela Rules in management of detention facilities.
 150 (M120, F30) border security officers and community residents benefitted from training by IPCB, ONS and MRU Secretariat on cross-border security and community policing to enhance security and prevent spread of COVID-19.  Supported establishment of 1 pilot virtual SGBV court to facilitate the continued delivery of justice services during COVID-19.
 Communication equipment (mobile phones and top up for 3 months) provided to Sierra Leone Correctional Services (SLCS) to facilitate continuity of communication between inmates and families during suspension of visitation to correctional centres.
